gw.pl.persistence.core

Class Bean

  • gw.pl.persistence.core.Bean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.guidewire.commons.entity.BundleProvider, Comparable<T>, gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject

    public class Bean
implements com.guidewire.commons.entity.BundleProvider, Comparable<T>, gw.lang.reflect.gs.IGosuObject
    A bean represents an instance of a persistent entity, and corresponds to a row in a database table. This interface includes an API for accessing the entity fields dynamically. Each entity also has a corresponding "type-safe" interface, which includes typed accessors for each of the entity fields.

    Note that there are some kinds of entities that are "non-persistent," i.e., don't have a table in the database. These include view entities and entities that are specifically defined as "non-persistent." Beans are used to represent instances of these entities, as well. Such beans always exist in their bundles as "new" (i.e., scheduled for insert) beans, but are never written to the database on commit.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean Changed
      Determines whether any fields on the bean have been changed from their original value, including owned arrays.
      Set<String> ChangedFields
      Gets the set of changed fields on this bean.
      Collection<IEntityPropertyInfo> ChangedProperties
      Gets the set of changed fields on this bean. Includes owned array fields where any of the owned array's elements have changed.
      String DisplayName
      Returns the display name of the particular Bean instance. If the bean type doesn't have a special display name method registered for it then this is equivalent to calling Bean.toString()
      IEntityType IntrinsicType
      {@inheritDoc}

      Overridden to return the entity specialization of {@link IType}.
      Bean OriginalVersion
      Given a bean with changes, returns a clone of the bean in a new bundle with all of its original values. Owned arrays are reset along with normal fields. Non-owned array fields are not reset.

      • Fields inherited from class com.guidewire.commons.entity.BundleProvider

        Bundle

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Collection<Bean> getAddedArrayElements(IArrayPropertyInfo array)
      Bean[] getAddedArrayElements(String array)
      Bean[] getChangedArrayElements(String array)
      Return the set of changed elements within an array. This method will not return elements that have been added or removed.
      Collection<Bean> getChangedArrayElements(IArrayPropertyInfo arrayProp)
      Return the set of changed elements within an array. This method will not return elements that have been added or removed.
      String getDisplayName(String displayType)
      Returns the display name of the particular Bean instance. If the bean type doesn't have a special display name method registered for it then this is equivalent to calling Bean.toString()
      Object getFieldValue(String field)
      Get the value of the named bean field, which can be a simple data field, foreign key field, array field or extension field. This only works for a datamodel property.
      Object getFieldValue(IEntityPropertyInfo field)
      Get the value of the given bean field. For link fields, returns the bean referred to by the link, and loads it into this bean's bundle. For array fields, returns an array of the component bean type. Each of the elements in the resulting array will be loaded into this bean's bundle. If the array is empty, returns an empty array. For all other field types, returns null if not value is set for that field.
      Object getOriginalValue(String field)
      Returns the original value of a field if it has changed, otherwise returns the current value. This method will not work for virtual foreign keys.
      Object getOriginalValue(IEntityPropertyInfo field)
      Returns the original value of a field if it has changed, otherwise returns the current value. This method will not work for virtual foreign keys.
      Bean[] getRemovedArrayElements(String array)
      Collection<Bean> getRemovedArrayElements(IArrayPropertyInfo array)
      boolean isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved(String array)
      Check if an element in an array has been added or removed.
      boolean isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved(IArrayPropertyInfo arrayProp)
      Check if an element in an array has been added or removed.
      boolean isArrayElementChanged(IArrayPropertyInfo array)
      Check if an element in an array has been changed. If no existing element has been changed, but elements have been added or removed, this will return false.
      boolean isArrayElementChanged(String array)
      Check if an element in an array has been changed. If no existing element has been changed, but elements have been added or removed, this will return false.
      boolean isFieldChanged(IEntityPropertyInfo field)
      Check for changes to a field.

      For non-owned arrays this is equivalent to using #isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved. For owned arrays this is equivalent to using #isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved || #isArrayElementChanged
      boolean isFieldChanged(String field)
      Check for changes to a field.

      For non-owned arrays this is equivalent to using #isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved. For owned arrays this is equivalent to using #isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved || #isArrayElementChanged
      void setFieldValue(IEntityPropertyInfo field, Object value)
      Sets the value of the given bean field.
      void setFieldValue(String field, Object value)
      Set the value of the named bean field, which can be a simple data field, foreign key field or extension field.
      Bean shallowCopy()
      Makes a copy of the bean into the bean's bundle. It copies all values from this bean to the copy. It does not copy arrays and just copies the foreign key pointers.

      • shallowCopy

        Bean shallowCopy()
        Makes a copy of the bean into the bean's bundle. It copies all values from this bean to the copy. It does not copy arrays and just copies the foreign key pointers.
        Returns:
        A copy of the bean

      • getFieldValue

        Object getFieldValue(String field)
        Get the value of the named bean field, which can be a simple data field, foreign key field, array field or extension field. This only works for a datamodel property.
        Parameters:
        field - the name of the field to get, case insensitive
        Returns:
        the value of the field

      • getFieldValue

        Object getFieldValue(IEntityPropertyInfo field)
        Get the value of the given bean field. For link fields, returns the bean referred to by the link, and loads it into this bean's bundle. For array fields, returns an array of the component bean type. Each of the elements in the resulting array will be loaded into this bean's bundle. If the array is empty, returns an empty array. For all other field types, returns null if not value is set for that field.
        Parameters:
        field - the field to get
        Returns:
        the value of the field, as described above.

        Returns:

      • isFieldChanged

        boolean isFieldChanged(IEntityPropertyInfo field)
        Check for changes to a field.

        For non-owned arrays this is equivalent to using #isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved. For owned arrays this is equivalent to using #isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved || #isArrayElementChanged

        Parameters:
        field - Field to check if changed
        Returns:
        True if the field exists on the bean and it has been changed; false otherwise

      • isFieldChanged

        boolean isFieldChanged(String field)
        Check for changes to a field.

        For non-owned arrays this is equivalent to using #isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved. For owned arrays this is equivalent to using #isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved || #isArrayElementChanged

        Parameters:
        field - Field to check if changed
        Returns:
        True if the field exists on the bean and it has been changed; false otherwise

      • isArrayElementChanged

        boolean isArrayElementChanged(IArrayPropertyInfo array)
        Check if an element in an array has been changed. If no existing element has been changed, but elements have been added or removed, this will return false.
        Parameters:
        array - Array to check for changes
        Returns:
        True if any field on any of the arrays current elements has changed

      • getOriginalValue

        Object getOriginalValue(String field)
        Returns the original value of a field if it has changed, otherwise returns the current value. This method will not work for virtual foreign keys.
        Parameters:
        field - Field for which to get original value
        Returns:
        If field has been changed then the original value is returned; if the field hasn't been changed then the current value is returned; if the field doesn't exist on the bean, or is a virtual field, NULL is returned

      • getOriginalValue

        Object getOriginalValue(IEntityPropertyInfo field)
        Returns the original value of a field if it has changed, otherwise returns the current value. This method will not work for virtual foreign keys.
        Parameters:
        field - Field for which to get original value
        Returns:
        If field has been changed then the original value is returned; if the field hasn't been changed then the current value is returned; if the field doesn't exist on the bean, or is a virtual field, NULL is returned
